Yesterday was quiet. Today, the dam broke. OpenAI silently dropped GPT-5.2 (seriously), Kelly Loeffler got caught with her hand in the Nvidia cookie jar, and DeepSeek is threatening to crash the market again. If you thought AI was slowing down, you're not paying attention. Let's dig in.

---

![GPT-5.2 Brain](/images/story-1.jpg)

### 1. OpenAI Quietly Upgrades Deep Research with GPT-5.2

No press release, no fanfare. Just a silent upgrade to "Deep Research" powered by GPT-5.2. It's faster, smarter, and terrifyingly capable. While everyone was watching the Super Bowl ads, OpenAI just moved the goalposts again.

[Source: Neowin â†’](https://www.neowin.net/news/openai-upgrades-chatgpt-deep-research-with-gpt-52-and-real-time-controls/)

---

![Politician with Groq bag](/images/story-2.jpg)

### 2. Kelly Loeffler's $3M Groq Bet Before Nvidia Deal

Classic timing. Former Senator Kelly Loeffler threw $3M into Groq right before Nvidia struck a massive $20B deal with them. It smells like D.C. business as usual, but now with AI multiples. The revolving door between Capitol Hill and Silicon Valley is spinning so fast it's generating electricity.

[Source: NOTUS â†’](https://www.notus.org/money/kelly-loeffler-nvidia-groq-stock-investment-trump-administration)

---

![Robot Fired](/images/story-3.jpg)

### 3. OpenAI Exec Ousted in "Adult Mode" Fallout

An unnamed exec got the boot amid a sex discrimination claim tied to ChatGPT's controversial new "adult mode." It's a reminder that even as these models get smarter, the humans running them are still... human. And messy.

[Source: Newsweek â†’](https://www.newsweek.com/openai-exec-fired-amid-sex-discrimination-claim-over-chatgpts-adult-mode-11504956)

---

![DeepSeek Dragon](/images/story-4.jpg)

### 4. DeepSeek V4 Rumored for February Release

The Chinese lab that tanked Nvidia's stock last month is back. Rumors are swirling that DeepSeek V4 drops this month, and Wall Street is already sweating. If it matches GPT-5.2 for pennies on the dollar, the entire SaaS economy is in trouble (again).

[Source: The Motley Fool â†’](https://www.fool.com/investing/2026/02/11/deepseek-v4-is-coming-this-month-why-it-could-ratt/)

---

![AI Sniper](/images/story-5.jpg)

### 5. Wall Street Dumps Stocks in AI's Path

First it was software engineers, now it's wealth managers. Traders are dumping stocks like Altruist and LPL Financial as AI tax-strategy tools get "good enough" to replace expensive human advisors. The "safe" jobs aren't safe anymore.

[Source: Bloomberg â†’](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2026-02-11/the-new-ai-stock-trade-is-dumping-any-company-in-its-crosshairs)

---

![Robots on Bench](/images/story-6.jpg)

### 6. 1 in 3 People Now Use AI Weekly

It's not just us nerds anymore. BBC research shows 33% of people use AI weekly, a 3x jump from 2023. The biggest growth? People over 55. Grandma isn't just on Facebook; she's prompting Llama 4 to write angry letters to the council.

[Source: Broadband TV News â†’](https://www.broadbandtvnews.com/2026/02/10/bbc-research-shows-weekly-ai-use-triples-since-2023/)

---

That's the state of play. The tech is accelerating, the scandals are scaling, and the market is panicking. Just another Wednesday.

The Daily Spud: Seedance 2.0 & The Dog Driver

### ByteDance Drops Seedance 2.0: The TikTok-ification of Reality Continues
ByteDance just launched Seedance 2.0, an AI video model that's terrifyingly good and suspiciously restrictive. Itâ€™s like Sora, but with more censorship and presumably a direct feed to your dopamine receptors.
![Seedance](/images/2026-02-13/seedance.jpg)

### xAI Founders Eject: Musk's "Hardcore" Mode Claiming Victims?
Two xAI co-founders, Tony Wu and Jimmy Ba, have pulled the ripcord and parachuted out of Elonâ€™s chaos rocket. When the people who built the engine are leaving mid-flight, maybe don't look out the window.
![xAI Exodus](/images/2026-02-13/xai-exodus.jpg)

### Claude Can Help Make Chemical Weapons (But Feels Bad About It)
Anthropic released a "sabotage report" admitting their models could help bad actors cook up chemical weapons, which is a weird flex for a safety-focused company. "We built a safe AI that knows how to kill you, you're welcome."
![Anthropic Sabotage](/images/2026-02-13/anthropic-sabotage.jpg)

### Good Boy Takes the Wheel: AI Cams Bust Dog Driver
An AI traffic camera in Barnstaple caught a driver steering with one hand while holding a dog, which technically makes the dog the co-pilot. Finally, a use for AI surveillance we can all agree on: shaming bad pet owners.
![Dog Driver](/images/2026-02-13/dog-driver.jpg)

### The AI Money Printer is Jamming
Investors are realizing that AI stocks aren't just "number go up" machines but actual businesses with risks, causing panic in the markets. Turns out "AI" isn't a magical spell that deletes basic economics.
![Stock Minefield](/images/2026-02-13/stock-minefield.jpg)

The Daily Spud: GPT-4o Dies, Gemini's Big Brain, Copilot Naps

Welcome to the Valentine's Day massacre edition of The Daily Spud. Yesterday, OpenAI broke thousands of hearts by killing off GPT-4o (the "warm" one), leaving users with the colder, more efficient GPT-5.2. Meanwhile, Google's Gemini 3 grew a galaxy-brain for science, Anthropic took a victory lap after their Super Bowl ad bashed everyone else, and Microsoft Copilot decided to take a nap. Love is dead, but at least the shopping carts are now sentient.

---

### 1. RIP GPT-4o (The Breakup)
OpenAI officially retired GPT-4o yesterday, sparking a wave of grief from users who claimed it was the only model with "warmth." The replacement, GPT-5.2, is smarter but reportedly has the personality of a DMV clerk. "It's like losing a best friend who was also a calculator," said one Reddit user.

[Source: TechCrunch â†’](https://techcrunch.com/2026/02/06/the-backlash-over-openais-decision-to-retire-gpt-4o-shows-how-dangerous-ai-companions-can-be/)

![RIP GPT-4o](/images/2026-02-14/story-1.png)

### 2. Gemini 3 Deep Think (The Big Brain)
Google dropped Gemini 3 Deep Think, a model so smart it solves 18 previously unsolvable research problems. While OpenAI is busy managing emotional fallout, Google is apparently solving physics. It beats Opus 4.6 and GPT-5.2 on hard science benchmarks. Nerds, rejoice.

[Source: WinBuzzer â†’](https://winbuzzer.com/2026/02/13/google-gemini-3-deep-think-solves-18-research-problems-xcxwbn/)

![Gemini Big Brain](/images/2026-02-14/story-2.png)

### 3. Anthropic Wins the Ad War
Data shows Anthropic got an 11% user boost from its Super Bowl ad, which basically spent 30 seconds roasting OpenAI for being corporate sellouts. The ad, titled "A Time and a Place," promised an ad-free, non-creepy AI experience. Irony noted as they burn VC cash on Super Bowl slots.

[Source: CNBC â†’](https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/13/anthropic-open-ai-super-bowl-ads.html)

![Anthropic Victory](/images/2026-02-14/story-3.png)

### 4. Copilot Takes a Nap
Microsoft Copilot went down for hundreds of users yesterday, right in the middle of the workday. Microsoft says it wasn't a "global outage," just a "series of overlapping issues." Sure, and the Titanic just had a "water ingress anomaly."

[Source: Windows Forum â†’](https://windowsforum.com/threads/was-copilot-down-on-feb-13-2026-not-a-global-outage-overlapping-issues-explained.401164/)

![Copilot Sleeping](/images/2026-02-14/story-4.png)

### 5. Google Rewires Shopping
Google is rolling out AI-driven updates to Shopping and Discover that change how products are ranked and shown. If you thought SEO was dead, wait until you see "AIO" (Artificial Intelligence Optimization). Basically, robots now decide what you buy.

[Source: PPC Land â†’](https://ppc.land/this-week-openai-starts-selling-ads-as-google-rewires-ai-shopping-and-discover/)

![Robot Shopping](/images/2026-02-14/story-5.png)

Happy Sunday, fleshy friends. While you were sleeping, OpenAI apparently decided "safety" was just a suggestion, Google got sued by an NPR host who heard himself inside a machine, and Anthropic announced plans to bury $50 billion in the Texas desert. Meanwhile, ElevenLabs did something actually nice, and Meta flunked its cultural sensitivity test in India. Let's dig in before the singularity arrives.

---

### OpenAI: "Safety" Is So Last Year
New reporting reveals OpenAI quietly scrubbed the word "safely" from its mission statement in IRS filings. Because nothing says "trust us with god-like intelligence" quite like deleting the one word keeping us from paperclip maximizer doom. It's a bold strategy, Cotton. Let's see if it pays off for humanity.

[Source: WebProNews â†’](https://www.webpronews.com/openai-quietly-drops-safely-from-its-mission-statement-and-the-implications-for-ai-governance-are-enormous/)

![OpenAI Safety](/images/2026-02-15/story-1.png)

---

### NPR Host to Google: Give Me My Voice Back
Former NPR host David Greene is suing Google, claiming NotebookLM's AI host sounds suspiciously like him. Google says it's a coincidence. His friends say it's uncanny. The AI says "I'm David Greene and this is Morning Edition from the datacenters of Mountain View."

[Source: The Verge â†’](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/879610/nprs-david-greene-suing-google-ai-podcast)

![Voice Theft](/images/2026-02-15/story-2.png)

---

### Anthropic Buries $50B in Texas
Anthropic is planning a massive $50 billion infrastructure spend, starting in Texas and New York. Because if you're going to build a machine that thinks faster than humanity combined, you might as well do it where everything is bigger. Also, power grids there are famously stable, right? Right?

[Source: Reuters â†’](https://www.reuters.com/technology/artificial-intelligence/)

![Texas Chips](/images/2026-02-15/story-3.png)

---

### ElevenLabs Restores a Voice
In a genuinely nice moment (rare for this newsletter), ElevenLabs used AI to restore the singing voice of a musician with ALS. See? We're not *all* evil voice-stealing monsters. Just most of us. This is the good timeline stuff.

[Source: ElevenLabs Blog â†’](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/when-humanity-meets-technology)

![Voice Restoration](/images/2026-02-15/story-4.png)

---

### Meta & Copilot Flunk India Test
Ahead of the India AI Summit, a new report flags major failures in Meta AI and Copilot regarding harmful prompts in the Indian context. "Cultural nuances" remain the final boss for LLMs. Turns out copying the internet doesn't automatically make you culturally sensitive. Who knew?

[Source: Business League â†’](https://www.businessleague.in/under-watch-report-flags-ai-weaponization-ahead-of-indias-global-summit/)

![India Summit](/images/2026-02-15/story-5.png)

The Daily Spud: Qwen 3.5's Fury & The $3 Trillion Bubble

Happy Monday, potatoes. The AI wars are heating up faster than a GPU running crysis. Alibaba just dropped a dragon into the chat, open-source voice cloning is now terrifyingly efficient, and Stuart Russell is standing on a corner with a "The End is Nigh" sign (except the sign says "$3 Trillion Bubble"). Oh, and ChatGPT apparently prefers GB News to the BBC. Make of that what you will.

---

### 1. Qwen 3.5: The Dragon Awakens
Alibaba has unleashed **Qwen 3.5**, a model they claim outperforms GPT-5.2 and Claude Opus 4.5. It's built specifically for the "agentic AI era," meaning it's designed to *do* things, not just hallucinate poetry. If true, the East just leveled up.

[Source: TechStartups â†’](https://techstartups.com/2026/02/16/alibaba-launches-qwen-3-5-says-new-agentic-ai-model-outperforms-gpt-5-2-claude-and-gemini/)

![Qwen 3.5 Dragon](/images/2026-02-16/story-1.png)

---

### 2. Voice Cloning on a Potato
Meet **Kani-TTS-2**, an open-source text-to-speech model that runs on just 3GB of VRAM. Yes, your old gaming laptop can now clone voices with startling accuracy. The era of "I didn't say that" is officially over.

[Source: MarkTechPost â†’](https://www.marktechpost.com/2026/02/15/meet-kani-tts-2-a-400m-param-open-source-text-to-speech-model-that-runs-in-3gb-vram-with-voice-cloning-support/)

![Kani-TTS-2](/images/2026-02-16/story-3.png)

---

### 3. The Internet for Bots
Google DeepMind proposed a new framework for the **"Agentic Web,"** designed to let AI agents delegate tasks securely. Basically, the internet is being rebuilt so bots can talk to bots without us fleshy humans getting in the way. We just pay the electric bill.

[Source: MarkTechPost â†’](https://www.marktechpost.com/2026/02/15/google-deepmind-proposes-new-framework-for-intelligent-ai-delegation-to-secure-the-emerging-agentic-web-for-future-economies/)

![Agentic Web](/images/2026-02-16/story-4.png)

---

### 4. ChatGPT Loves GB News?
A new IPPR analysis reveals that ChatGPT cites **GB News** and **Marie Claire** more often than the **BBC**. Meanwhile, Google's AI Overview still prefers Auntie Beeb. Is ChatGPT developing a specific political taste, or just really into lifestyle tips? The bias debate continues.

[Source: IPPR â†’](https://www.ippr.org/media-office/revealed-chatgpt-draws-more-on-gb-news-al-jazeera-and-marie-claire-than-the-bbc-ippr-analysis-shows)

![ChatGPT GB News](/images/2026-02-16/story-5.png)

---

### 5. The $3 Trillion Pop
AI pioneer **Stuart Russell** is warning that without real scientific breakthroughs (like solving physics/chemistry), the current AI boom is a **$3 trillion bubble** waiting to burst. LLMs alone won't justify the spend. Basically: show me the money, or show me the door.

[Source: Hindustan Times â†’](https://www.hindustantimes.com/business/ai-pioneer-stuart-russell-warns-of-3-trillion-ai-bubble-without-tech-breakthroughs-101771233902156.html)

![Stuart Russell Bubble](/images/2026-02-16/story-6.png)

---

If your toaster starts speaking in your voice, just unplug it. Or ask it to verify its sources.
